intro: Pentaraphia viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered pentaraphia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
